Containers¶

Defines various data containers for plotting a transect.

copyright:2015 Agile Geoscience
license:Apache 2.0
class containers.BaseContainer(params)¶

Holds some basic information that we want in every object. Does not contain any data or pointers, only the transect parameters. Maybe eventually we can abstract some of the methods here too.

Parameters:params (dict) – The params you want to store. None are compulsory.
reset_all()¶

Called at the start of an update. Just to make sure everything is empty.

No args, no return. Side-effect: sets attributes.

reset_data()¶

Set some basic objects to empty placeholders.

No args, no return. Side-effect: sets attributes.

class containers.BedrockContainer(bedrock_dir, params)¶

Contains a geological map or similar basic geology shapes.

update(transect)¶

Updates the container data to a profile that intersect the transect line.

Returns nothing. Sets attributes as a side effect.

Parameters:transect (LineString) – A transect line.
class containers.ConstantVelocityContainer(velocity, params)¶

Class for handling constant velocity models

__str__()¶

Needed for adding metadata to ‘description’.

depth2time(data, point, dz, dt)¶

Converts a data array in the depth domain to the time domain.

Parameters:
  • data (array, 1d) – A 1D numpy array.
  • point (float) – distance along transect corresponding to the trace location. Not actually used, as this model assumes a constant velocity. Kept for consistency with other velocity methods.
  • dz (float) – The sample interval of the input data.
  • dt (float) – The sample interval of the converted data.
depth2timept(d, point)¶

Converts a single sample from depth to time.

Parameters:
  • d (float) – Depth in metres.
  • point (float) – Range along transect in m. Not used here, only for consistent API.
Returns:

TWT [s]
Return type:

Float
time2depth(data, point, dt, dz)¶

Converts a data array from time to depth

Parameters:
  • data (array, 1d) – A 1D numpy array.
  • point (float) – distance along transect corresponding to
  • trace location. Not actually used, as this model (the) –
  • a constant velocity (assumes) –
  • dt (float) – The sample interval of the input data.
  • dz (float) – The sample interval of the depth converted data.
time2depthpt(t, point)¶

Converts a single sample from time to depth.

Parameters:
  • t (float) – TWT in seconds.
  • point (float) – Range along transect. Not used here, only for consistent API.
Returns:

Depth [m].
Return type:

Float
update(transect)¶

Does nothing, velocity is constant

exception containers.ContainerError¶

Generic error class

class containers.ElevationContainer(elevation_file, params)¶

Container for managing and plotting elevation data.

Parameters:elevation_file – Raster file containing the elevation profile of the area of interest.
update(transect)¶

Updates the container data to a profile that intersect the transect line.

Returns nothing. Sets attributes as a side effect.

Parameters:transect (LineString) – A transect line.
class containers.HorizonContainer(hor_dir, velocity, params)¶

Class for reading and plotting seismic horizons.

Parameters:
  • hor_dir (str) – Input directory containing seismic SEGY files.
  • velocity (Object) – A velocity container for time-depth conversion.
  • params (dict) – The parameters, as specified in the config.
update(transect)¶

Gather the data near the transect. Depth convert if necessary.

Returns nothing. Side effect: sets attributes.

Parameters:transect (LineString) – A shapely LineString object.
class containers.LocmapContainer(layers, params)¶

Class for building and plotting a location map.

Parameters:
  • layers (dict) – The relative paths to files to use as layers.
  • params (dict) – The parameters, as specified in the config.

Example

>>> layers = ['geology.tif', 'roads.shp']
>>> params = {'domain': 'depth', 'buffer': 300, ... }
>>> mc = LocmapContainer(layers, params)
update(transect)¶

Updates the container data to a profile that intersect the transect line.

Returns nothing. Sets attributes as a side effect.

Parameters:transect (LineString) – A transect line.
class containers.LogContainer(well_dir, params)¶

Container for managing and plotting LAS data.

Parameters:well_dir (str) – Directory shape files of LAS headers.

Example

>>> well_dir = 'wells/logs/'
>>> params = {'domain': 'depth', 'buffer': 300, ... }
>>> lc = LogContainer(well_dir, params)
get(log_id)¶

Returns data corresponding to log_id.

update(transect)¶

Updates the container data to a profile that intersect the transect line.

Returns nothing. Sets attributes as a side effect.

Parameters:transect (LineString) – A transect line.
class containers.PotfieldContainer(potfields, params)¶

Contains potential field data.

update(transect)¶

Updates the container data to a profile that intersect the transect line.

Returns nothing. Sets attributes as a side effect.

Parameters:transect (LineString) – A transect line.
class containers.SegyContainer(segy_dir, params)¶

Superclass for handling Segy data.

Parameters:
  • segy_dir (str) – Input directory containing Segy files.
  • params (dict) – The parameters, as specified in the config
  • Example –
  • seis_dir = 'seismic/segy_files/' (>>>) –
  • params = {'domain' (>>>) – ‘depth’, ‘buffer’: 300, ... }
  • segy = SegyContainer(seis_dir, params) (>>>) –
update(transect, flat=False)¶

Updates the container data to a profile that intersect the transect line.

Returns nothing. Sets attributes as a side effect.

Parameters:
  • transect (LineString) – A transect line.
  • flat (Bool) – Reads data into a flat list instead of sorting by files.
class containers.SegyVelocityContainer(vel_dir, params)¶

Container for managing velocity profiles.

See SegyContainer.

__str__()¶

Needed for adding metadata to ‘description’.

depth2time(trace, point, dz, dt)¶

Converts a data array in the depth domain to the time domain.

Parameters:
  • data (array, 1d) – A 1D numpy array.
  • point (float) – distance along transect corresponding to the trace location. Not actually used, as this model assumes a constant velocity. Kept for consistency with other velocity methods.
  • dz (float) – The sample interval of the input data.
  • dt (float) – The sample interval of the converted data.
depth2timept(d, point)¶

Converts a single sample from depth to time.

Parameters:
  • d (float) – depth in meters
  • point (float) – range along transect

returns: twt [s]

time2depth(trace, point, dt, dz)¶

Converts a seismic trace from time to depth.

Parameters:
  • trace (array, 1d) – A 1D numpy array.
  • point (float) – distance along transect corresponding to the trace location.
time2depthpt(t, point)¶

Converts a single sample from depth to time.

Parameters:
  • t (float) – time in [s]
  • point (float) – range along transect

returns: depth [m]

update(transect)¶

Updates are done by the superclass.

class containers.SeismicContainer(seis_dir, velocity, params)¶

Class for reading and plotting seismic data.

Parameters:
  • seis_dir (str) – Input directory containing seismic SEGY files.
  • params (dict) – The parameters, as specified in the config.

Example

>>> seis_dir = 'seismic/segy_files/'
>>> params = {'domain': 'depth', 'buffer': 300, ... }
>>> seis = seismicContainer(seis_dir, params)
update(transect)¶

Gather the data near the transect. Depth convert if necessary.

Returns nothing. Side effect: sets attributes.

Parameters:transect (LineString) – A shapely LineString object.
class containers.SimpleVelocityContainer(vel_dir, params)¶

Class for handling simple velocity profiles read from text files. Simple example below, # are not parsed and are used as comments.

coordinates, 150,20.25

# time [s], depth [m] 0, 0 1000, 1000 2000, 2000 3000, 3000

__str__()¶

Needed for adding metadata to ‘description’.

Converts a data array in the depth domain to the time domain.

Parameters:

  • dz (float) – The sample interval of the input data.
  • dt (float) – The sample interval of the converted data.

  • trace location. Not actually used, as this model (the) –
  • a constant velocity (assumes) –
  • dt (float) – The sample interval of the input data.

update(transect)¶

Gather the data near the transect. Depth convert if necessary.

Returns nothing. Side effect: sets attributes.

Parameters:transect (LineString) – A shapely LineString object.
class containers.TransectContainer(**kwargs)¶

Main driver class for generating transect plots. Builds and accesses all other plot containers

Parameters:
  • params (dict) – Directory containing shape files of the transects.
  • data (dict) – Contains the shape files for the various sub-containers.
  • layers (dict) – Contains the shape files for the map.
plot()¶

Generates plot for the transect.

exception containers.VelocityError¶

Gerneric error class.
